summary: Federal student loan payments were paused for more than 3 years due to COVID-19. Payments resumed in October 2023. This Q&A report looks at how the Department of Education communicated with borrowers about resuming their payments. Before payments resumed, Education notified borrowers about the upcoming change via email, text message, social media, and its website. It also sent information to borrowers about temporary relief options...
title: Federal Student Loans: How Education Has Communicated with Borrowers About Resuming Payments
